result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose D Rodriguez Cruz

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:00 AM case called. Defendant Jose D Rodriguez Cruz in court.  Attorney Steve Laxton appeared by video for Jose D Rodriguez Cruz.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
 Maribel Marin, Spanish Interpreter, is sworn and interprets. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas-  Received by the Court. 
A status conference is scheduled for 11/14/22 at 1:30 pm for 30 minutes (zoom for defense and interpreter). 
Adjourned: 11:08 am.

9:39 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jose D Rodriguez Cruz in court with Attorney Steve Laxton appeared by phone. Spanish Interpreter Monica Marin appears via Zoom and is sworn. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Branch 5 for scheduling.

Adj: 9:45 AM
Defendant's Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver
